page.title: 12JERSEY MUSEUM,ST.HELIER
page.content: The Jersey Museum in Pier Road, St. Helier is owned by the Societe Jersiaise, the local learned society, which has its library and member's room in part of the building. The Jersey Heritage Trust, recently formed to co-ordinate the various museum and art resources of the island, also has its office there. The actual museum, open to the public 6 days a week, houses many different exhibits, from a whale to coins, a Jersey kitchen to a pharmacy, reminders of Lillie Langtry to relics of the German Occupation enthusiastically loaned by islanders for a lively display opened in 1985 to commemorate the 40th anniversary of the Liberation. Future plans include the construction of a new building and redevelopment of the old to enable visitors to enjoy actual participation in the expositions.
